subject: Re: Junit 3 suite setup tear down
msgSnippet: ... No, I am not. I just want that doYourOneTimeSetup() would be run once for ANY suite that run. doYourOneTimeSetup() will startup microcontainer. Parameters
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <david@...> wrote:

> > Actually it is not very convenient method to do it. For example, I
> > want to run JBoss microcontainer in doYourOneTimeSetup(), so I want to
> > do it for ANY suite that I will run and they very. I want to test some
> > aspect of the system, and afterwards, another aspect and so on. This
> > will force me to change this class every time. See also next point.
>
> I actually don't quite understand this. Are you saying that you're
> changing the startup parameters to your microcontainer by hand between
> each run of your test suite?

No, I am not. I just want that doYourOneTimeSetup() would be run once
for ANY suite that run. doYourOneTimeSetup() will startup
microcontainer. Parameters to it doesn't changdes.

> >> > Morevoer, suppose, you want to run only some specific methods from
> >> > those classes, not all the methods, how can you do it
> >> > In JUnit 3.8.x
> >> > there was a way to do it.
> >>
> >> What was your favorite?
> >
> > public static Test suite() {
> >
> > TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
> >
> > suite.addTest(MoneyTest.class, "fooName");
> >
> > return suite;
> > }
>
> True, this is not as easy in 4.4. Choosing individual methods to run
> from the command line or Eclipse is fairly simple, but mixing and
> matching methods from multiple classes takes a fair amount of magic.
> Do you find yourself wanting to do this often? (I usually am either
> running a whole suite, one class in the suite, or one method).
When I write some code or fix the bug I usually want to run some
subgroup of the test suite. I should split up my suite to the smaller
one, I know, but I couldn't to do it easily and, in fact, architecture
don't want to do it.
